item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Argentina unveiled a controversial plan aimed at preventing a default, while hinting it was willing to negotiate with holdout creditors.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Consumer prices rose 0.4% in May from April, the most in over a year, fueling debate over whether the Fed should move sooner to raise rates.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: China blocked a tie-up of the world's three largest container-shipping firms, saying the alliance would control 47% of the Asia-to-Europe market.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: U.S. stocks rose in light trading, led by small-company and financial shares. The Dow advanced 27.48 to 16808.49

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: GE is considering the sale of its train-signaling business to as it bids for the French firm's energy assets

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Amazon.com is expected to reveal its first smartphone on Wednesday, with as the exclusive carrier.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Jefferies posted a 55% jump in profit, avoiding the headwinds that are slowing bigger Wall Street banks.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: TD Ameritrade routinely sends customer orders to trading venues that pay the best, an executive told senators.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: SunTrust settled allegations of abusive mortgage practices in a $968 million deal with the government.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: The World Cup match between the U.S. and Ghana drew a record 15.9 million viewers on ESPN and Univision.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: SolarCity agreed to buy Silevo, a maker of high-efficiency solar modules.
